_prev_prog_3.MD_OtherType: Routine visual inspection by trained operators

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Analysis:  Studies are conducted to ensure the hazards associated with process operations are identified, understood and controlled.
                                                                                                                                                                             Operating Procedures:  Written operating procedures are maintained for covered process operations.  The Contractors procedures address the following activities:  Initial startup, normal, temporary, emergency shutdown, normal shutdown, and startup following a turnaround.
                                                                                                                                                                                      Hot Work Permits:  In order to assure adequate controls are used in work where conditions could cause ignition of flammable combustible materials, the Hot Work Permit System will be utilized.  Hot work involves any welding, soldering, cutting, grinding, drilling or any type of work where sparks may occur during operation.  These permits will be utilized where the supervisor deems them necessary for job safety.  It will be the supervisor¿s responsibility to ensure the proper procedures are followed and keep the appropriate records.
                                                                                                                                                                                   Training:  A program is in place to ensure employee(s) are knowledgeable and trained in procedures associated with the covered processes.  Verification of Contractor training has been documented.
                                                                                                                                                                           Mechanical Integrity:  Covered process equipment is maintained consistent with generally accepted engineering practices.  Covered process equipment is routin

The United Suppliers, Inc.¿Cimarron Ks operation is committed to employee, public and environmental safety.  This commitment is demonstrated by continually improving both practices and measures to prevent the release of regulated substances.  In the event of a release, the Cimarron facility is prepared to work with the Grey Co LEPC and/or other authorities to mitigate any release and minimize the impact of people and envirnment.  The Cimarron facility¿s primary covered process activity is the mixing of fertilizers.  These activities include storage and processing of anhydrous ammonia.  Anhydrous ammonia is received, stored and processed into 10-34-0 non-hazardous liquid fertilizer.  Processing is periodic throughout the year.  Ammonia mixing with phosphoric acid occurs in a T-reactor.  Water is used as both a reaction feed material and product stabilizer.  The Emergency Response Procedures for Cimarron are coordinated with the Grey Co LEPC.
                                                                                                                                                                                   United Suppliers, Inc.¿Cimarron Ks has taken the necessary steps to comply with accidental release prevention requirements set forth in 40 CFR Part 68.  Cimarron is also covered by OSHA¿s Process Safety management standard.  The following briefly describes the prevention program elements in place at this stationary source.
                                                                                                                                                                               Process Safety Information:  The facility maintains information describing the chemical hazards, operating parameters and equipment designs associated with the covered process.
                                                                                                                                                                               Process Hazard

ely inspected and tested.  Maintenance activities are conducted by qualified personnel.  Deficiencies are corrected in a timely manner.
                                                                                                                                                                            Management of Change:  Written procedures are in place to manage changes in process chemicals, technology, equipment, and/or procedures.  Affected personnel are informed and trained to deal with authorized system changes.
                                                                                                                                                                                      Pre-Startup Review:  Technical and operational reviews will be conducted on new processes and/or modifications to existing covered processes.  Reviews confirm the construction, equipment, operations and maintenance procedures are suitable.
                                                                                                                                                                          Compliance Audits:  Internal audits are conducted to determine the root cause of covered process incidents.  In addition to determination and corrections, investigations are retained for five (5) years.  United Suppliers, Inc. Loss Control Department resides at Eldora Ia, providing additional incident investigation support.
                                                                                                                                                                             Employee Participation:  United Suppliers, Inc.-Cimarron Ks employee(s) actively contribute in the following:  process hazard assessments, operating procedure development, maintenance procedure development, training development and implementation, pre-startup reviews, incident investigations, and compliance audits.  Additionally, employee(s) have access to all information pert

aining to the facility¿s RMP.
                                                                                                                                                                            Contractors:  Periodically, Cimarron Ks may hire contractors to conduct specialized operations, maintenance and construction activities.  Prior to work, contractors are trained on the covered processes, relevant process safety information and emergency response actions.
                                                                                                                                                                                          Five (5) Year Accident History:  There have been no accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia in the past five (5) years that have resulted in deaths, injuries or significant property damage.  Nor to our knowledge, has there been any releases resulting off-site deaths, injuries, evacuations, property damage and/or environmental damage.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      Emergency Action Plan:  United Suppliers, Inc.-Cimarron Ks has a written emergency action plan.  This plan includes notification of the Grey Co LEPC.  Local authorities have been provided with emergency planning and community right-to-know information.
